result.execSummary:
The defendant James Anthony Tuchalski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With any other sentence. Huber privileges for work, school and treatment.
Court does not object to HOC time and Condition time being transferred to Waukesha County.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all costs and surcharges by the end of probation. If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation. If not paid a civil judgment to be entered.
*Court ordered no DNA sample or surcharge as this is a misdemeanor and it predates the 04/01/15 change in law.

*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.

*NO illegal drugs.
*NO controlled substances without valid prescription.
*NO contact with drug community.

*AODA and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens. No positive results.

timeConds.notes: Concurrent with: *Huber privileges for work, school and treatment. The court stayed  this time to be used at the probation agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Anthony Tuchalski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James Anthony Tuchalski in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant complied with State's conditions of the plea agreement.  Court entered judgment of conviction be entered into the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

AS TO EACH COUNT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:

*As a condition of probation, the court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days condition time in the House of Correction.  Huber privileges for work, school and treatment. The Court STAYED this time to be used at the probation agent's discretion.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Court ordered no DNA sample and no DNA surcharge, as this is a misdemeanor and it predates the April 1, 2015 change in law.
- Pay all costs and surcharges by the end of probation. If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Court does not object to House of Corrections time and Condition time being transferred to Waukesha County.

Appeal rights given.    

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
filed, Count 1: Fleeing contrary to Wis. Stats. 346.04(2t), a Misdemeanor, Count 2: Obstructing an Officer contrary to Wis. Stats. 946.41(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Court withheld the Judgment of conviction until sentencing, on which defendant completes conditions of plea agreement.   Restitution will be discussed at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.

Defendant James Anthony Tuchalski in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant James Anthony Tuchalski in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court with defendant James Anthony Tuchalski.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-01-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Anthony Tuchalski in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Lucy Kronforst for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/18/15.
HMP

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Anthony Tuchalski in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant James Anthony Tuchalski in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
